p: The biosynthetic pathway of RA has been comprehensively elucidated, and eight enzymes involved in the different steps have been characterized so far [ 70]. The initial precursors of RA are the aromatic amino acids L-phenylalanine and L-tyrosine, which are transformed to the intermediates 4-coumaroyl-CoA and 4-hydroxyphenyllactic acid (pHPL), respectively ( Figure 2).
